path: books/Topology Without Tears/2. The Euclidean Topology/2.2 Basis for a Topology

attr.q: In this exercise you will prove that disc $`\{\langle x,y \rangle :x^2 + y^2 < 1\}`$ is an open subset of $`\mathbb{R}^2`$, and then that every open disc in the plane is an open set.
In this exercise you will show that the collection of all open discs in $`\mathbb{R}^2`$ is a basis for a topology on $`\mathbb{R}^2`$. [Later we shall see that this is the euclidean topology.]
